titlestmt.subtitle: Papers, 1952-2000, of Suzanne Jill Levine at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlestmt.author: Electronic finding aid encoded by Maya Lerman.

XML finding aid derived from HTML version through cutting and pasting.
Finding aid encoded by Maya Lerman, Lilly Library, Indiana University, April 14, 2008

did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: Consists of the papers of translator and author, Suzanne Jill Levine.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Suzanne Jill Levine was born in 1946 in New York City. Levine is a freelance translator and author, a professor of Spanish and Portuguese as well as a lecturer on literary translation at numerous universities across the country. She has translated authors Adolfo Bioy-Casares, Guillermo Cabrera Infante, Julio Cortazar, Carlos Fuentes and others. She was translator and friend of Manuel Puig and wrote his biography Manuel Puig and the Spider Woman: His Life and Fictions (Farrer, Straus, and Giroux: New York, 2000).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: I. Correspondence; II. Writings. The collection is arranged as received.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Consists of the papers of translator and author, Suzanne Jill Levine. The correspondence consists of photocopies of Manuel Puig's correspondence as well as Levine's own correspondence with Puig and others. The writings are mostly Levine's translations and her critical work on Puig and her Latin America Fiction and Poetry in Translation (Center for Inter-American Relations: New York, 1970).

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item] Levine mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

scopecontent.p: Organized into two subseries: The Manuel Puig correspondence includes correspondence both from and about Puig, collected by Levine for her biography of him and are mostly photocopies. Levine's correspondence with other writers follows. The files may include manuscripts and other materials as indicated.
